comments:
Steps used to create problem:

1. Use mylar update site for e3.1 installing on Eclipse 3.1.1

2. When prompted select new installation target outside of the normal eclipse
plugin directory (i.e. C:\Java\eclipse-plugins_3.1.1\Mylar_Eclipse_3.1x was used)

3. Install, restart

4. Attempt to show any of the Mylar views you'll see an error similar to the
following (this being for ActiveHierarchyView):
"Unable to Create View: Plug-in org.eclipse.mylar.java was unable to load class
org.eclipse.mylar.java.ui.views.ActiveHierarchyView."
Error Details:

This class appears to be present in mylar-java.jar which exists inside
C:\Java\eclipse-plugins_3.1.1\Mylar_Eclipse_3.1x\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.mylar.java_0.4.2.1.jar
on my set-up.

I don't know what steps I should take to fix it so the classes inside these jars
show up in the classpath where Mylar can see them.

-G

That is very strange.  I assume that you have been successful installing other
plug-ins with this procedure.  Could you attach your entire
<worskpace>/.metadata/.log file?  In the menatime I will try a Mylar install
outside of the regular directories.

Created an attachment (id=30241)
workspace metadata .log file

contains details of mylar install also contains extranous info from other
plugins

If you are running Win32, you may find my plug-in linker script (epl2.cmd)
helpful in setting up an external plugin dir.

http://stacktrace.org/index_html/20051118-EclipseWin32Scripts

These are the root exceptions in the log:

Root exception:
java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: org/eclipse/mylar/java/MylarJavaPlugin (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass0(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:537)

Which indicates that Mylar is attempting to load in a 1.4 VM.  See the following FAQ entry for how to address this: http://eclipse.org/mylar/doc/faq.html#install-failure

Also, I suggest that you update to 0.4.5 this evening, possibly before trying to reinstall again, because the log indicated some update connection failures so there is a (small) chance that not all the plug-ins downloaded successfully.  If you still see failures after trying that please reopen.
